intro: Batrachium ololeucos, commonly known as the white batrachium, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, rounded seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
